title.rendered: How Does Shatavari Help With Menopause Symptoms?

content.rendered:
In This Article

  • 1 Benefits of Shatavari For Menopause:
  • 2 Ways To Take Shatavari For Menopause:
    • 2.1 In Tea Form
    • 2.2 In Tablet or Capsule Form
    • 2.3 In Powder or Granule Forms

Suffering from menopausal symptoms? What if you knew that a single herb, shatavari for menopause, could take care of all your menopausal symptoms. Shatavari is a wild variety of asparagus. It has been used in Ayurveda for centuries as a female reproductive tonic.

Shatavari can be a natural alternative to HRT or Hormone Replacement Therapy. Because it contains ‘phytoestrogens,’ which are similar in function and structure to ovarian or placental estrogen. Shatavari acts as a hormone modulator and does all the work of HRT with little to no side effects involved.

Benefits of Shatavari For Menopause:

  • It acts as an antioxidant and balances the vaginal pH levels.
  • It relaxes the central nervous system and decreases hot flashes and night sweats.
  • It reduces vaginal dryness.
  • It reduces stress levels and enhances the immune system to function more efficiently.
  • It increases strength and energy.
  • It alleviates body tissue depletion that takes place during menopause.
  • It nourishes the female reproductive organs. This way it compensates for the depleting sex hormones during menopause. As a result, the recipients can continue to have a healthy sex life.

Ways To Take Shatavari For Menopause:

In Tea Form

Steep it in hot water and have it like a tea. You can also mix honey if you want the drink to be a little sweet. You can also mix it with a glass of warm milk for ease of digestion. Shatavari is also available as a liquid extract.

In Tablet or Capsule Form

You can take the herb as a supplement. It is advisable to take two tablets each day after meals. Or you can take it as prescribed by a herbalist or a medical professional.

In Powder or Granule Forms

You can add the herb to smoothies or yogurt when in powder or granule forms. You can also take it with a glass of warm water.

Although there are no known side effects of Shatavari yet, it is always better to consult with an expert before taking it.
